poem:
**Against the Tide**

In Folkestone's sea, no signs deter—  
Tony, waist-deep, cuts through brown  
waves and murmurs the unsaid.  
An MP in trunks, rebelling—  
drops of defiance  
thread through salt.  
Silence washes shores, still,  
as wet echoes of purpose  
linger, dissolve in the  
cool embrace  
of tides unmaking wrongs.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s wrong’: the Labour MP speaking out against the party’s asylum policy Before Monday morning, Folkestone and Hythe’s backbench Labour MP Tony Vaughan was best known for his slick, pro-government Instagram reels. In one, he dives into the brown sea off the Kent coast, ignoring a no swimming sign, to show constituents that Labour has made progress tackling water pollution; a few minutes later, he emerges in his trunks, as the 007 theme tune plays.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘It’s wrong’: the Labour MP speaking out against the party’s asylum policy Before Monday morning, Folkestone and Hythe’s backbench Labour MP Tony Vaughan was best known for his slick, pro-government Instagram reels. In one, he dives into the brown sea off the Kent coast, ignoring a no swimming sign, to show constituents that Labour has made progress tackling water pollution; a few minutes later, he emerges in his trunks, as the 007 theme tune plays.
